com.i2group.apollo.commandservice

Interface ICommandService


  • public interface ICommandService
    A pair of methods for executing commands and renewing leases that affect the contents of the Analysis Repository.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExecuteCommandsResult executeCommands(CommandList commandList)
      Executes the Commands in the specified CommandList, in the order they appear.
      Collection<ItemIdentifier> renewLeases(String sessionId, List<ItemIdentifier> leaseTargets)
      Renews the leases on the Items with the specified ItemIdentifiers, for the session with the specified ID.

    • Method Detail

      • executeCommands

        ExecuteCommandsResult executeCommands(CommandList commandList)
                                      throws DataSourceOutOfDateException,
                                             LeaseNotHeldException,
                                             LeaseRequiresLatestVersionException,
                                             LeaseInUseException,
                                             ItemNotFoundException,
                                             ValidationException,
                                             DeletionStatusException,
                                             GrantPermissionDeniedException,
                                             AccessPermissionDeniedException,
                                             TooManyCardsException,
                                             TooManyLinksException,
                                             ItemSupplantedException,
                                             TooManyLinksToMergeException
        Executes the Commands in the specified CommandList, in the order they appear.

        Note: The Commands are subject to the rules of ProhibitedOperation indicators in the schema. If a command attempts to perform a prohibited operation, then this method throws a ValidationException.

        Parameters:
        commandList - The CommandList that contains the Commands to be executed.
        Returns:
        An ExecuteCommandsResult containing information about the Items created or modified by the Commands.
        Throws:
        DataSourceOutOfDateException - If a request contains an out-of-date data source version.
        LeaseNotHeldException - If a command tries to modify an item without holding a lease for it.
        LeaseRequiresLatestVersionException - If a command tries to modify an item that is not at the latest version.
        LeaseInUseException - If a command tries to modify an item whose lease is already in use, even if the item is not at the latest version.
        AccessPermissionDeniedException - If a command tries to perform an operation for which the current user has insufficient access permissions.
        GrantPermissionDeniedException - If a command tries to perform an operation for which the current user has insufficient grant permissions.
        ItemNotFoundException - If a command tries to modify an item that does not exist, or that the current user cannot see.
        DeletionStatusException - If a command tries to act upon an item that is marked as deleted, or tries to undelete an item that is not marked as deleted.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        TooManyCardsException - If a command tries to add cards to an item that would take the item over the configured maximum number of cards.
        TooManyLinksException - If a command tries to add links to an entity that would take the entity over the configured maximum number of links.
        ItemSupplantedException - If a command tries to act upon an item that is marked as merge deleted.
        TooManyLinksToMergeException - If a command tries to perform a merge operation involving source entities with more links than the configured maximum.

      • renewLeases

        Collection<ItemIdentifier> renewLeases(String sessionId,
                                     List<ItemIdentifier> leaseTargets)
                                       throws DataSourceOutOfDateException
        Renews the leases on the Items with the specified ItemIdentifiers, for the session with the specified ID.

        If a lease has expired but no other client session has acquired it, then the lease is renewed. If an Item's lease cannot be renewed, this method does not throw exceptions.

        This method will never fail due to lack of access permissions. The current user must have had access permissions to get the lease in the first place, and only the current user could have changed the permissions while the lease was held.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - A String containing the client's session ID.
        leaseTargets - The ItemIdentifiers of the Items whose leases are to be renewed.
        Returns:
        The ItemIdentifiers of any Items whose leases could not be renewed for any reason.
        Throws:
        DataSourceOutOfDateException - If a request contains an out-of-date data source version.
